name: omni-pilot
title: Omni Pilot
description: OmniPilot is your all-in-one AI copilot for Raycast. It connects to top LLMs via OpenRouter to help you ask questions, analyze screen content, summarize text, translate, improve code, and more â€” all directly from your desktop. Stay focused, work smarter, and bring AI everywhere you need it.
author: alorse

commands.name: ask
commands.title: Ask AI
commands.subtitle: Ask AI
commands.description: Get instant answers to any question using powerful language models.

preferences.name: prompt
preferences.title: System Prompt
preferences.description: The prompt to use for this command.
preferences.default: You may be given a text or a query or a picture as input, please provide a detailed and informative response in the same language as the original.

commands.name: translate-text
commands.title: Translate Text
commands.subtitle: Translate Text
commands.description: Translate selected content into your preferred language instantly.

preferences.name: openrouterApiKey
preferences.title: API Key
preferences.description: Your API key to access AI models

preferences.name: defaultModel
preferences.title: Model
preferences.description: Which model for Raycast uses by default (unless overriden by Custom Model).

preferences.name: customApiUrl
preferences.title: API URL
preferences.description:
Custom API URL for Omni Pilot.
NOTE: If you set a custom API URL, you MUST also provide a Custom Model below.
This is useful if you use another LLM provider. It will override the default API URL.
Leave this empty if you want to use OpenRouter's standard API.

preferences.name: customModel
preferences.title: Custom Model
preferences.description:
Custom model name to use with your API URL.
REQUIRED if you specified a custom API URL above.
Leave this empty if you're using OpenRouter's standard models from the dropdown.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
